snippet: As a Jan. 1 deadline looms, Gov. Bill Haslam remains torn on whether to expand Medicaid and is trying to negotiate a plan of his own with federal officials.
abstract: Tennessee Gov Bill Haslam is still debating whether to expand state's Medicaid rolls as prescribed by Pres Obama's Affordable Care Act; decision involves balancing conflicting interests, including fierce conservative opposition to law; Haslam is trying to negotiate plan of his own with federal officials.
lead_paragraph: As a Jan. 1 deadline looms, Gov. Bill Haslam remains torn on whether to expand Medicaid and is trying to negotiate a plan of his own with federal officials.

headline.main: Tennessee Governor Hesitates on Medicaid Expansion, Frustrating Many
headline.print_headline: Tennessee Governor Hesitates on Medicaid Expansion, Frustrating Many

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
